concept.title: Understanding Spark Plugs
concept.shortdesc: Spark plugs are essential engine components that ignite the gasoline charge in cylinders through a high-voltage current, with one plug positioned at the top of each cylinder.

section.title: Location and Access
section.p: Each spark plug is located at the top of its respective cylinder. They can be easily removed using the spark plug wrench provided with the vehicle, after disconnecting the wire connection.

section.title: Operation
section.p: The spark plug operation follows this process:

ul.li: High voltage current flows from the secondary coils in the coil box
Current reaches the contact points in each spark plug
Current jumps a 1/32" gap, creating a spark
This spark ignites the gasoline charge in the cylinders

section.title: Maintenance Guidelines
section.p: For optimal performance, follow these maintenance guidelines:

ul.li: Keep spark plugs clean and free from carbon deposits
Replace malfunctioning spark plugs rather than attempting repairs

Maintain perfect contact in all wire connections to:
Spark plugs
Coil box
Commutator

section.title: Important Note
section.p: The manufacturer-installed spark plugs are specifically designed for optimal performance in engines, regardless of contrary recommendations from service providers.
